Reviews.Title: “Our New Home in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa R
Reviews.Content: I booked through Expedia and left the same review on their site. I loved the experience so much, I wanted to make sure those searching Trip Advisor also saw it! We stayed four days in April 2012 and hated to leave. The only thing more inviting than the lovingly and beautifully designed hotel was the superb staff; Quick with a smile, a dinner reccomendation/reservation, or offer of a hotel umbrella when it rained. This hotel is all about the details - the room feels like you are staying not at Anna Fendi's hotel, but as a guest in her own home. The room was gorgeous - full of amenities and personal touches (great for couples!). It's surrounded by a lush, tucked away garden that feels far from the hustle of Rome while still being right in the thick of it (One Metro stop from the Vatican). The area is more upscale, safe and quiet with a great neighborhood feel; you're just steps away from some great reastaurants and shopping that feel more local than overcrowded with tourists. Breakfast in the main Villa every morning was delicious. The beds were the only comfortable ones we had our entire trip throughout Italy. This was by far the best hotel experience on our trip (of ANY trip) - we will not think of staying anywhere else in Rome and will sing the VIlla's praises to anyone who will listen.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish with atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Svegaard
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stylish and is placed away from the street. The walls are not the thickets and the rooms are not the largest. However this is an experience in terms of style. In fron there is a mansion which is under refurbishment - but no nosie or dust from the work. This will become restaurant and spa in a new part of the hotel. According to the reception the hotel is owned by Fendi and there is indeed quite a number of Fendi things around. We stayed a family in 2 rooms and if you like something else than the normal business hotel this is perfect. Stay away from the breakfast and take the 2 minutes to the carrefour for breakfast shopping. And be prepared for some walking to the Metro. Bring an addres for the hotel if you plan to us taxies. And enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice try but not ready for guests”
Reviews.Author: klova2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at, in fact am writing from, Villa Laetitia and have to say we are extremely disappointed. The only person on staff we've met is Miguel, who is very very nice and helpful, but it's as if whoever owns this place woken up one day and said, "I think i'll run a hotel today." The property is under construction, which we were told in an email upon booking, but it said it "might" affect the "entrance" but would not affect our rooms. Well, the entrance is indeed trashed, but the grounds are also affected (the garden is not set up and chairs are stacked in corners). The room is big enough for us (we were told we HAD to book the suite for 3), but the floor is covered in construction dust. My feet are black if I walk barefoot. Not affected? I also can smell the dust and we can feel it when we breath in. IT's everywhere, not just contained to the entrance, which is 30 meters away. I said something to Miguel, again he is so nice, but he became defensive and said, "We told you there was construction." Well, that's true so I guess we are wrong to complain. The shower, as someone indicated below, is ridiculous. So small you can't bend over, or escape the water to shampoo your hair. No shelf in the sower means you have to step out to get shampoo and soap, and when you do, the water gets everywhere because the shower is literally, no exaggeration, 2 x 2 feet. We were shown the breakfast room when we arrived and assuming we could go there in the morning (breakfast time), we showed up at 9 to a darkened room, only to be told we had to let them know we wanted breakfast. Would have been nice to know that upon arrival. Internet service is slow slow slow. Took me 5 minutes to open this page. My husband can't even log onto the network and had to go ask if he would use their hard wire to download a contract he needs to sign. We are three people in our room, but only received 2 towels. All and all, it's not a place to enjoy a relaxing holiday. For the prince (290 euros a night) we could have found a place closer to the center, with staff who have run a hotel before. The location is quiet and pretty, but not anywhere you can grab a taxi or metro There are also no other guests in the hotel. I guess they were smarter than us upon booking. Lesson learned. Pluses: bed is comfy. air conditioning works well. miguel tries super hard but has limited tools at his disposal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, somewhat disappointing accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: nydy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "Senior Suite" - "Atelier Room" - which would be better in nice weather than in the winter. The room, with small kitchenette, was too small and had no comfortable seating. If you stay in this room during warm weather, you have a lovely private, outside terrace which is larger than the room. The kitchenette was well supplied and a definite plus for the room. The metal spiral stairs leading from the sleeping area to the outside terrace are just about 12" from the foot of the bed, causing many leg bruises. The towels and toiletries that were provided were nice, but the bathroom was barely big enough to turn around in. One of the desk clerks was quite helpful, but otherwise the service from front desk staff was spotty - gave incorrect directions to something which was just was just two blocks away, had no change to provide to guests for use in their coin operated coffee machine, etc. The housekeeping staff were outstanding - efficient, pleasant and consistent. In general the location is great - mostly a residential fairly quiet residential area. One of the eleven nights while we were staying there they had a large party in the patio area and, as usual, the staff left at ll:00pm with no one at the front desk or anywhere else in the hotel to supervise the party which went on until 1:00am. From 11:00pm until 1:00pm the music was sooooo loud that it sounded as if it were being played at full volume in our "sleeping" room. When I complained to the desk clerk the following morning he acted offended, but no offer of any discount, complimentary breakfast or even an apology. The wireless internet system worked sometimes and for short periods.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: CVAOxford
Reviews.Content: We had no difficulties finding the "hotel" as other have pointed out, but don't look for neon lights or anything flashy. The area is quiet but close to the center, and full of restaurants, bars and gelatterias. We stayed at the Star Room and loved it. It was just what we needed. The rooms are carefully furnished and decorated. The lighting is perfect and the garden is beautiful. Make no mistake though, this is not a hotel or a bed and breakfast. It is a room-kitchenette combo. A nice romantic designer room.

Reviews.Title: “Non Funtional”
Reviews.Author: DavidJMontreal
Reviews.Content: We were fortuate to have visited Rome twice this summer.We stayed at this hotel in September. We arrived at night and had a great deal of difficulty getting in through the unmarked gates. Staff was helpful. The rooms are decorated and furnished with designer furniture and fashions which are fine to photograph but totally non functional. They are overcrowded. Both my wife and I had bruises from smashing into things. One bed (we changed rooms) had a headboard and a footboard which made it impossible for anyone over 6ft tall to sleep. The tiny shower had a rain shower head which poured water all over the place because it was bigger than the shower. There was absolutely noone else in the hotel. In June we stayed at the absolutely perfect Villa Spaletti Trivelli. For more or less similar amounts of monet there is absolutely no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: beaglepix
Reviews.Content: After reading glowing remarks about Villa Laetitia, imagine our disappointment in finding the Villa neglected. The front entrance was weed infested and the front entrance was broken apart with pieces of glass lying on the ground. After beeing buzzed in, we had to drag our luggage thru gravel to their reception area. We were given our key to the Garden Suite, but never was told about the property, room, nearby restaurants, etc. The staff was not helpful in our efforts to locate the bus stations, or even arrange taxi service. Very disappointing (and expensive, to boot!)

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JessAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Why stay in a hotel in the busy city centre when you can experience living in a leafy green suburb of Rome in such an amazing property - gardens, roof top terrace a beautiful 1900's mansion? We stayed at Villa Laetita for 8 nights in May in the Loden room and I could not have imagined a better place to have stayed. The property is beautiful and you feel relaxed as soon as you walk through the gates from a busy and sometimes hectic city. The surrounding suburb is lovely and the local restaraunts are far superior to anything you will find in the 'touristy' areas. Having a small kitchenette was fantastic and there is a supermarket 50 metres from your door. The staff were wonderful and very helpful, they made us feel very welcome. Our room was cleaned spotlessly each day. The metro station is very close - a short stroll & a couple of minutes to all the sites by train. We never had a problem getting around by train or foot. I could not have imagined a better place to stay in Rome and look forward to visiting again. Thankyou to Eva, Miguel and all the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: lilly5
Reviews.Content: Villa Laetitia is a beautiful hotel set back from a busy street. It is a bit tricky to find, but once my husband and I got all checked in, we were extremely pleased with our room. They were kind enough to upgrade us from a superior room to a senior suite (the Round room), and we could not have been happier with our suite. It was absolutely gorgeous - a home away from home. After settling into our room, we awoke the next morning to begin sightseeing. It's about a 10 to 15 minute walk to the nearest metro station. Once you get on the metro it's a fairly quick ride to anywhere you want to go. Now, at first glance, this may not seem like much of an inconvenience, and for some, it may not be. But we found that we were much less likely to take those much needed small breaks in the afternoon at the hotel because of its distance from most of the major sites. Instead, we found ourselves feeling that once we were out and about, we were out to stay, which meant that by the time we headed back to the hotel, we were exhausted, and what seemed like a short walk in the morning seemed very long after a long day of sightseeing. That being said, the neighborhood is adorable, and the accommodations are fantastic, so you have to choose for yourself as to how important it is to have easy access to the main attractions, but it's definitely something to take into consideration, and we found it to be the only drawback of the hotel. The staff is extremely helpful. Ava's dinner recommendations were perfect. We never would have found the places she suggested, but after eating there, we wouldn't have chosen to eat anywhere else. All in all, this was a fabulous experience. One final word, we came back to Villa Laetitia for one night before we flew back home, and we stayed in the Hoffman Room. Definitely pay the money and splurge for a suite. It is absolutely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterM20
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Garden Suite for 4 nights in March for a long weekend in Rome and had an absolutely wonderful time. Plans to get out and about early in Rome fell by the wayside when faced with the option of lounging in the morning sunshine on our private terrace having breakfast (which frequently turned into lunch before we managed to get moving). The Villa Laetitia has inspired us to completely change our hotel selections for all future city breaks, having the private terrace and tiny kitchen made the holiday feel like a relaxing villa holiday as well as a glamorous city break. The building and the grounds are beautiful and completely private. The hotel is wonderfully quiet given how close you are to the city centre and you are only a five minute walk from the nearest metro stop which is very cheap, frequent and efficient. The staff were wonderfully helpful, everything from advising on transport to getting reservations in local (fully booked) restaurants at short notice. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “charming place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CaracasCorrespondent
Reviews.Content: The taxi dropped us off at the hotel at about 6 pm, and I immediately worried that I had screwed up in my choice. We couldn't see the hotel. We could see only a big gate that we couldn't see through. After a couple of minutes, we figured out to push a buzzer, and the gates swung inward. Still, I didn't feel much better because we then had to drag our luggage through a driveway filled with pebbles. The payoff came a minute later when we came upon the hotel in the back. The friendly clerk at the counter directed us to our room. It was cozy but nicely designed. We learned that each of the rooms had been designed differently. The Villa Laetitia did not look like your normal hotel. It is hidden behind an old-fashioned villa. But the uniqueness provides much of the charm. We liked the location. The hotel is located on an street that winds alongside the Tiber River. You can't actually see the river because of shrubbery where the hotel is situated. But you can walk in either direction, get clear of the shrubbery and cross the river. The hotel is also near a neat cafe where we ate breakfast and a restaurant where we ate tasty pasta. The hotel was not close to any of the main tourist spots. But that was ok since it gave us the chance to explore on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience away from the Hustle & Bustle”
Reviews.Author: sharonwMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Laetitia in late September 2008. We found it a little difficult to find at first as, because it is a private villa, there are no big signs out the front and is easy to miss. Once located, a little trouble getting buzzed in which was abit off putting seeing we had just arrived in Rome and were feeling displaced anyway. However, once these issues were sorted, we found the staff friendly and willing to please. We stayed in the Garden Room which was lovely, however, no real place to sit comfortably besides the bed. There was a wrought iron bench seat and a wrought iron chaise lounge, but without cushioning, not very comfortable. The Garden Room had direct access onto the shared garden terrace which was lovely. I found the kitchen very basic and lacking in a range of utensils...I wasn't expecting every type of gadget, but basic things...eg. tongs, veg peeler, were missing and lots of improvising had to be done...I think this could be improved on. It was a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest metro, Lepanto, which we enjoyed, and a supermarket between the metro and the Villa where you could buy pretty much anything you need. If you want to stay somewhere "in the action', this is not the place, however a good place to stay away from the hustle and bustle of the city where you can relax and unwind. We found the room very clean and it was serviced every day. Relatively good value for money and would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, a peaceful retreat in a bustling city”
Reviews.Author: Moonsk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a beautifully renovated Villa in the suburbs (about 20 minutes walk from the top of Via del Corso, and about 30 minutes walk from Centro Storico) of Northern Rome; Anna Fendi has done a fabulous job of decorating each room individually and making it an absolute pleasure to call 'home' while you stay in this amazing city. The hotel is not traditional in the sense that it doesn't really provide any meals (it is possible to have breakfast provided, but at 20euros for tea and croissant, and 30euros for tea, croissant and ham/cheese/etc. it's better to do breakfast yourself), but the rooms are extremely comfortable and beautifully furnished. We stayed in the Garden Suite, which has it's own private balcony and kitchenette. The room has a mezzanine with a chaise longue, a compact but fully kitted out bathroom (jacuzzi bath, shower, bidet etc.) and comes with all the 'extras' you'd expect from a high end hotel (robes, slippers, nice toiletries etc.). The kitchenette has a kettle, fridge (with small freezer compartment), hob and all the utilities you'd need for preparing a decent breakfast, and there's a small supermarket just round the corner for the essentials (though the markets in Rome have some fabulous fresh fruit and veg). The staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful; they booked a private transfer from the station to the hotel on our arrival (they also arrange these from the airport) and for the return (bit more expensive than a taxi but nice to have someone waiting for you when you arrive on the overnight train from Paris!). They are knowledgeable, and will book anything you need locally, as well as advising on the best way to get around. We (my wife and I) loved this hotel, and think it's possibly one of the best city hotels we've stayed in - highly recommended if you want to be close to the city but like a bit of peace and quiet at night. We will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: FDN
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, Great staff, convenient location, rooms are very comfortable Will return again and again Looking forward to the main house being completed

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Idea”
Reviews.Author: mle_webb
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my dad and 11 year old niece for a few nights and days. The location is really nice. It is not a far walk to the centre and most of the sites of Rome. But the hotel is out just far enough that the nights are quiet and peaceful. We took a cab from the train station and it cost 20 euros. (BEWARE of a man that yells taxi and grabs your bags. He only wants to take your bags to the curb and then demands money) The hotel is just as pretty in person as it looks online. This is a self service hotel and there is a grocery store nearby to get food. They will do a breakfast for you if you request and give them time to come to your room and set it up. The breakfast is nice but really expansive for what it is. The outside is really gorgeous and the setting is fabulous. We had an outdoor patio and the black and white room was big enough for the three of us. The bed was possibly the most uncomfortable bed I have slept in for a long time. The floor needed a good scrub! They do give you slippers and I was wearing them the moment I walked in the door because the floor was really dirty. They also give you a cozy robe. The staff were so friendly and helped us plan our trip into Rome. I did not ask them to clean the floor so maybe if I had it may have been a better stay. Overall it is a gorgeous hotel.. if they only mopped the floors!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - very very clean”
Reviews.Author: Bedub247
Reviews.Content: Villa Laetitia is a very nice, small hotel in a residential area of Rome. It was very clean and quiet, and we had no complaints. Would be a good choice if you want somewhere quiet and do not mind walking, but if you're looking to be in the heart of Rome's touristy/site-seeing district, look elsewhere. We might stay closer to "everything" next time, although I have the feeling we won't get the service/cleanliness that we got at Laetitia. I wasn't just completely blown away, so I didn't go with the 5 dots - but as long as you're prepared to walk, you won't be disappointed with Laetitia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection.”
Reviews.Author: quern
Reviews.Content: My wife & I traveled to Italy for our one year anniversary. Rome was our last stop and I happened to find out about Villa Laetitia when browsing a travel magazine. I almost passed by the write up it was so small. Well, I must agree with the magazine that it was a wonderful, small, secret of a hotel. We stayed in the Garden suite and loved every night. The staff was extremely helpful, advising us how to get around via the transit system. The neighborhood was safe and the grounds very quite at night. Learning how to get into the grounds was easy since I had already read a previous trip advisor post about the buzzer at the gate. I must say that the Garden suite was cozy, enough channels in English to keep us satisfied when watching tv before going to bed, and the grounds were beautiful (I'd like to see them in the spring). The bath is on the smaller side, like most European hotels, and not really meant for showering (if you do you'll end up with water all over the floor). Needless to say, we would not hesitate to stay at the Villa on our next trip to Rome. Very Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome - Can't miss”
Reviews.Author: drex13
Reviews.Content: Villa Laetitia is a wonderful hotel that is about 1mi. NE of the Vatican right on the Tiber. The location is perfect - about 5-10min. walk to either the Lepanto Metro station or the Piazza del Popolo/Flaminio Metro station. Since you are slightly away from the city, the noise level is very low - you are staying in a real Roman neighborhood. There is a supermarket 20ft. from the door, and a cafe, local restaurant, and pizza place within 1/2 block. They are very good, and very inexpensive, being local places. We had 2 cappucino and 2 pastries for 3 euro every morning before heading to the city. The neighborhood is very nice and safe, and worth the extra few minutes walk compared to staying inside the older part of the city by the tourist sights. Hotel accommodations were excellent, the basic room was quite large even compared with US rooms in big cities, with excellent shower, kitchenette, and satellite TV. Room was very, very clean, and we immediately felt at home. English-speaking staff was incredibly helpful with any/all needs, recommending places to visit/eat, and even checking times on attractions to make sure we didn't miss anything. A courtyard would be a nice place to relax in the summer, and since the grounds are relatively large, you are about 100ft. of the main street, so nighttime noise was very low. No chance of staying anywhere else next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Marius77
Reviews.Content: My girldfriend and I have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Villa Laetitia and it was a great experience, quite a tribute since I wasn't in a good mood cos the cab driver from the airport conned me out of 50 euros!!!. The room was very unusual in its decor and made a nice change from standard hotel furniture. The girl on reception was called Eva and couldn't have been more helpful. It's a mere 15 min walk to central rome and less than 5 to Lepanto metro stop... Top tips...get the bus/train/tube from the airport, we got 4 cabs during our stay, all drivers were rude, some dangerous and 1 was a conman. Eat at Trattoria de Gensola in Trastevere...best meal ever.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quirky, 'boutique' hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MikeAmanda
Reviews.Content: We picked the Laetitia after looking at reviews for dozens of hotels in Rome. We were not disappointed. The location was fine.. a little out of the main centres, but (for us, keen walkers) only about 20 minutes from the Spanish Steps, the same to the Vatican and only 10 minutes from the nearest Metro (Lepanto, red line A ). The accomodation is in a modest villa set in the grounds of a larger villa, right on the main, riverside road (Lungatevere Delle Armi, west bank) a short distance from the nearest bridges. We picked the cheapest option, and got the Bambu room, just behind reception.. previous reviews had said this was a small, dark room... well, if you live in a 2 metere cave, yes, it would be! It was about 5 meters square, with a king-queen size bed (very comfy, memory-foam mattress and pillows), high ceilings with lovely mouldings and attractive, reclaimed wall and floor tiles throughout. There was a small kitchenette with full-size fridge (the only bit we used!), two ring hob, sink and a full range of crockery etc. The shower room was a good size, although the shower cabinet was tight for me (1.9m). Don't turn it on full either, as the funky, square shower rose squirts some water vertically up to the ceiling! All the sheets, towels etc were of high quality and changed every day! They even provide bathrobes and slippers! A flat screen tv/dvd and limited satelite service were also laid on. The gardens around the property are lovely and tranquil, idela for a late-night bottle or three of Chianti! (Only kidding! We only had one or two! ) Reception is open from 7-ish til 11pm (although often later) and you have keys and codes to access the premises outside these hours. The staff were friendly and helpful. Oh, and if it rains, there's a stack of monogrammed umbrellas available for guests to use at no charge. Breakfast can be had from the Mary Cafe about 200m away, open early for coffee and paninis/croissants etc, at low cost. We'd recommend the hotel, and go back ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet enchanting villa”
Reviews.Author: justmarried92207
Reviews.Content: The Villa was a fabulous place to stay on our honeymoon. It was so lovely and quiet and away from all the noise of Rome. The hotel staff was absolutely great and friendly. I will be recommending Villa Laetitia to anyone that visits Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. I say again Wonderful!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BlondinaCalgary
Reviews.Content: We totally loved this hotel.The staff was truly helpful in everything and greeted you with a smile everytime you saw them.The rooms are clean and each one is different and special in their own way.The garden is wonderful to sit in and relax after a long day sight seeing.There is a supermarket right behind the hotel which is very handy and cute little resturant just down the street with great food.Sights are a bit of a walk but it was good to get away from all the noise and crazyness and you always feel safe behind the iron gates.We very much enjoyed our stay and would book there again in a heartbeat.Thank you again Villa Laetitia!!! Ali and Sherry

Reviews.Title: “Unique Accomodations in a Nice Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: basianov
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Villa Laetitia at the end of May when Rome was experiencing a bit of a heat wave! Upon arrival, we were unsure how to get inside the huge gates that protect the property; luckily, one of the staff was outside accepting a delivery, and he warmly ushered us inside. For the rest of your stay, you are given a password that operates the gates. Hands down, the best thing about this place was the staff. Francesco and Federica were wonderful, friendly, and spoke English very, very well. Francesco was especially helpful in recommending restaurants (Cacio e Pepe just around the corner was a delightfully inexpensive place to have a meal the first night we arrived). He also pointed out a small cafe/bar that served freshly baked croissants in the mornings; it was also just around the corner and we might have overlooked it had we not known it was there! (Please note that Villa Laetitia, as it is more residence-style hotel, does not include breakfast in the morning as many hotels in Italy do. Therefore, those inexpensive and delicious croissants were welcome!). Our room, the Loden, was very dark and small. The bed takes up much of the room. The bathroom, as well, was very tiny. There is also a miniscule kitchen for use. However, quite truthfully, we do not spend much time in our rooms when traveling, so the accomodations were all we needed and more than adequate. The room's cooling system was great (and we needed it, given the heat!), the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom, though small, was clean and well-appointed. We really had everything we needed, and it was nice to have a fridge and stove for use (and they will clean your dishes/stove if you use them), given that a grocery store was also just around the corner! In addition, the room was very stylish! A good deal for the price in an expensive city. The grounds were very interesting; I felt like I was encapsulated in an overgrown fairy-tale. Very nice to sit outside and enjoy a glass of wine in the evening. The Villa is a bit far from most of the sights. For us, a mile walk is never a problem and we welcome the exercise. Those who prefer not to walk so far have the choice of using the Metro - a stop was conveniently located very close-by. We enjoyed staying away from the hustle of the city center and felt that the neighborhood was very nice and safe, right by the Tevere. Leaving for the airport was not a problem, even though we had a 6:30am flight. Federica arranged a taxi for us, which was a much cheaper alternative than a private car. He arrived just on time without any trouble. All in all, we were happy to have chosen this unique place to stay, and would consider returning!

Reviews.Title: “First impressions”
Reviews.Author: kmmaas
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Villa Laetitia. We saw the funny side of our first impressions which initially threw us. As travellers from the US our dollar limited our choices of accomodation. Laetitia however was luxurious and great value for money in an otherwise expensive city. We booked a standard room to keep within our budget. Our friends from the UK paid more to book a larger apartment. The location of Villa Laetitia is excellent for the sites of Rome. It is quiet, secluded behind secure gates and an oasis from the madness of the traffic and crowds closer in the heart of Rome. We were happy to walk (most sites about a mile away) but also took advantage of the efficient taxi service. Laetitia is tucked behind a large building located at the hotel's address. We were not the only guests to walk through the doorways of this prominent building which opened into a cavenous reception area which unfortunately was in the process of being furnished/ plastered/rewired you name it! We thought we had arrived to our worse holiday nightmare that booking a hotel on line could provide!! A sign to direct guests to the back of the premises would be strongly recommended to avoid heart racing disappointment for new arrivals who just might turn around and 'escape' before even finding the intended destination - a warmer, more sophisticated reception in a separate building at the back of the estate. First impressions of our room were disappointing. The door from the hotel patio opened straight into our bedroom which was square, compact, dark-ish and with no obvious windows (they did exist but were small, shuttered and had vines growing outside. Sounds awful but really, we got value for our money. The room was beautifully decorated and provided for. Room service excellent. Features modern and in good condition. We could not complain but would have hoped for a more open vista on arrival. Our friends room was wide open, spacious. We made good use of their space to enjoy wine out on their private patio which created a unique experience of Rome (buying groceries at the local supermarket nearby also added to the whole experience of Roma. Front desk staff were friendly, helpful and respectful. They made great efforts to help us make plans for a rainy day which apparently spells disaster for tourists as all cabs/guides/museums are booked solid. Our perspective on our accommodation may have been different had we not been able to share our friend's larger apartment. Let us know what you think!

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Laetitia
HotelInfo.Address: Lungo Tevere delle Armi, 22/23, 00195 Rome, Italy
